content.question:
HUMAN DEVELOPMENT INDEX (HDI) AND GENDER INEQUALITY INDEX (GII)HDIRanking Country HDI GII GII Ranking 1 Norway 0.95 0.048 8 2 Switzerland 0.94 0.039 1 3 Australia 0.94 0.109 25 4 Ireland 0.94 0.109 25 5 Germany 0.94 0.072 16 6 Iceland 0.94 0.062 11 7 Sweden 0.93 0.044 3 8 Singapore 0.93 0.067 8 9 Netherlands 0.93 0.044 3 10 Denmark 0.93 0.040 2 Source: United Nations Development Programme
Australia, Ireland, and Germany have the highest GII values in the table shown. What do these countries' high GII values indicate when compared to their HDI values?

choices.label: These countries offer greater access to womenâ€™s health care despite lower levels of economic development.
These countries are characterized by greater empowerment among a wealthy female population.
These countries have less disparity between men and women than in wealthier countries.
These countries have less gender equality despite high levels of education and health care.
These countries have the greatest gender equality as a result of high levels of education and health care.

content.answer: These countries have less gender equality despite high levels of education and health care.

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Compare patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
